resources.string: A real-time form checker for push-up progressions

Get into position! For accurate tracking,
position your head towards the top of your phone.

Simply go back to end the session.

Hands
Hands should be on the wall, around shoulder-height or lower.

Legs
Keep your legs straight and around shoulder-width apart.

Body
Make sure to keep your body in as straight of a line as possible. You can do this by squeezing your glutes and keeping your abs tense.

Elbows
When performing the push-up, avoid “flaring” your elbows by keeping your elbows close to your body—keep them around 0° to 45°.

Head
Keep your head neutral and centered throughout the movement—refrain from looking up, down, or around.

Range of motion
Go all the way down until your chest either hits the wall or brushes up against it.

Scapula
Your scapulae should be fully depressed. At the top of the motion, they should be protracted. They should retract at the bottom, and return back to protracted at the top.

Hands
Hands should be on a surface higher than the ground, ideally directly underneath the shoulders or somewhere close by.

Legs
Keep your legs straight and around shoulder-width apart.

Body
Make sure to keep your body in as straight of a line as possible. You can do this by squeezing your glutes and keeping your abs tense.

Elbows
When performing the push-up, avoid “flaring” your elbows by keeping your elbows close to your body—keep them around 0° to 45°.

Head
Keep your head neutral and centered throughout the movement—refrain from looking up, down, or around.

Range of motion
Go all the way down until your chest either hits the elevated surface or brushes up against it.

Scapula
Your scapulae should be fully depressed. At the top of the motion, they should be protracted. They should retract at the bottom, and return back to protracted at the top.

Hands
Hands should be directly underneath your shoulders.

Legs
Keep your knees at around a 90° angle, with your knees on the floor. You may cross your feet if that is more comfortable.

Body
Make sure to keep your body in as straight of a line as possible. You can do this by squeezing your glutes and keeping your abs tense.

Elbows
When performing the push-up, avoid “flaring” your elbows by keeping your elbows close to your body—keep them around 0° to 45°.

Head
Keep your head neutral and centered throughout the movement—refrain from looking up, down, or around.

Range of motion
Go all the way down until your chest either hits the floor or brushes up against it.

Scapula
Your scapulae should be fully depressed. At the top of the motion, they should be protracted. They should retract at the bottom, and return back to protracted at the top.

Hands
Hands should be directly underneath your shoulders.

Legs
Keep your legs straight and around shoulder-width apart.

Body
Make sure to keep your body in as straight of a line as possible. You can do this by squeezing your glutes and keeping your abs tense.

Elbows
When performing the push-up, avoid “flaring” your elbows by keeping your elbows close to your body—keep them around 0° to 45°.

Head
Keep your head neutral and centered throughout the movement—refrain from looking up, down, or around.

Range of motion
Go all the way down until your chest either hits the floor or brushes up against it.

Scapula
Your scapulae should be fully depressed. At the top of the motion, they should be protracted. They should retract at the bottom, and return back to protracted at the top.

Hands
Hands should be directly underneath your shoulders.

Legs
Place your feet on a surface higher than the floor. Keep your legs straight and around shoulder-width apart.

Body
Make sure to keep your body in as straight of a line as possible. You can do this by squeezing your glutes and keeping your abs tense.

Elbows
When performing the push-up, avoid “flaring” your elbows by keeping your elbows close to your body—keep them around 0° to 45°.

Head
Keep your head neutral and centered throughout the movement—refrain from looking up, down, or around.

Range of motion
Go all the way down until your chest either hits the floor or brushes up against it.

Scapula
Your scapulae should be fully depressed. At the top of the motion, they should be protracted. They should retract at the bottom, and return back to protracted at the top.

Hands
Hands should be closer to the hips, somewhere underneath the waist. You can rotate the hands externally if that is more comfortable.

Legs
Keep your legs straight and around shoulder-width apart.

Body
Make sure to keep your body in as straight of a line as possible. You can do this by squeezing your glutes and keeping your abs tense. Lean forward slightly as you perform the movement.

Elbows
When performing the push-up, avoid “flaring” your elbows by keeping your elbows close to your body—keep them around 0° to 45°.

Head
Keep your head neutral and centered throughout the movement—refrain from looking up, down, or around.

Range of motion
Go all the way down until your chest either hits the floor or brushes up against it.

Scapula
Your scapulae should be fully depressed. At the top of the motion, they should be protracted. They should retract at the bottom, and return back to protracted at the top.
